text: Hello everyone, I wanted to know if there is a way to associate the tickets and the conversation part of HubSpot, here is my problem: we want to have in our shared inbox a tab for example "Followed" to avoid that our team can put the useless mails in this tab instead of putting it in the trash. thanks for your help
cool cool, let me know if you don't solve it
Not exactly sure yet, just got into the alpha myself probably 3-6 months if I was to take a bet though
Currently there isn't a way to directly associate them. It's something I've been trying to get from HubSpot for a long time.
Currently the only somewhat working way is to associate the contact to the ticket and hope that that automatic association system picks up the new conversation
So, trying to export Content History & found this:
Except that when I go there, the highlighted option does not exist.  Anyone else dealt with this?
Might have been a HubSpot issue: <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/gl9k1b6gcxj0>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Interesting, I'm seeing that option on my side, do you have CMS content?

That's really interesting! Maybe?

If that's not the case, what would you suggest?
Possibly try from a different domain and see if that's it
lots of domains are can just get really trash scores from google for past incidents

Here's what I did to solve this:
• Create a mandatory field to move to deal won that can't be edited by end users
• That property is set to "yes" by a workflow when the properties I need filled out have been filled by a playbook that users can access on the deal page ("closed won playbook")
• If set to yes, users can move it, otherwise, they can't!
You can create a link from the conversation and attach as a note on the ticket.
